segment.source: How to Install a Database
segment.target: How to Install a Database

segment.source: How to Install a Database
segment.target: How to Install a Database

segment.source: How to Install a Database
segment.target: How to Install a Database

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to install a database for your server-based deployment of Application Virtualization if a database is not already available.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to install a database for your server-based deployment of Application Virtualization if a database is not already available.

segment.source: Typically, in a production environment, you will connect to an existing database.
segment.target: Typically, in a production environment, you will connect to an existing database.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: To install the database, you must use a network account with the appropriate permissions.
segment.target: To install the database, you must use a network account with the appropriate permissions.

segment.source: If your organization requires that only database administrators are allowed to create and conduct database upgrades, scripts are available that allow this task to be performed.
segment.target: If your organization requires that only database administrators are allowed to create and conduct database upgrades, scripts are available that allow this task to be performed.

segment.source: To install a database
segment.target: To install a database

segment.source: Navigate to the location of the Application Virtualization System setup program on the network, either run this program from the network or copy its directory to the target computer, and then double-click Setup.exe.
segment.target: Navigate to the location of the Application Virtualization System setup program on the network, either run this program from the network or copy its directory to the target computer, and then double-click Setup.exe.

segment.source: On the Welcome Page, click Next.
segment.target: On the Welcome Page, click Next.

segment.source: On the License Agreement page, to accept the license agreement, select I accept the license terms and conditions, and click Next.
segment.target: On the License Agreement page, to accept the license agreement, select I accept the license terms and conditions, and click Next.

segment.source: On the Registering Information page, specify the User Name and Organization information, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Registering Information page, specify the User Name and Organization information, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Setup Type page, select Custom and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Setup Type page, select Custom and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Custom Setup page, deselect all Application Virtualization System components except Application Virtualization Server, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Custom Setup page, deselect all Application Virtualization System components except Application Virtualization Server, and then click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If a component is already installed on the computer, by deselecting it on the Custom Setup screen it will automatically be uninstalled.
segment.target: If a component is already installed on the computer, by deselecting it on the Custom Setup screen it will automatically be uninstalled.

segment.source: On the Database Server page, type the passwords, assign an installation path, save the information, and click Next.
segment.target: On the Database Server page, type the passwords, assign an installation path, save the information, and click Next.

segment.source: Select a name for the database, and then click Next.
segment.target: Select a name for the database, and then click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If error 25109 is displayed when you try to complete this step, you have incorrectly set up the permissions necessary to install the database.
segment.target: If error 25109 is displayed when you try to complete this step, you have incorrectly set up the permissions necessary to install the database.

segment.source: For details on setting up the necessary SQL permissions, please see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=132144.
segment.target: For details on setting up the necessary SQL permissions, please see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=132144.

segment.source: On the Directory Server screen, enter a domain name and credentials that Application Virtualization Servers and the Management Web Service will use to access your domain controller, save this information, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Directory Server screen, enter a domain name and credentials that Application Virtualization Servers and the Management Web Service will use to access your domain controller, save this information, and then click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The installation will default to the domain of the current computer.
segment.target: The installation will default to the domain of the current computer.

segment.source: On the Administrator Group page, enter the name of a group that will have Administrator privileges, save this information, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Administrator Group page, enter the name of a group that will have Administrator privileges, save this information, and then click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can also enter the first few characters of the name of a group that will have Administration privileges, click Next, and on the Select Administrator Group screen, select the group from the resulting list.
segment.target: You can also enter the first few characters of the name of a group that will have Administration privileges, click Next, and on the Select Administrator Group screen, select the group from the resulting list.

segment.source: Then save this information and click Next.
segment.target: Then save this information and click Next.

segment.source: On the Default Provider Group page, enter the complete name of a group that will control access to applications, save this information, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Default Provider Group page, enter the complete name of a group that will control access to applications, save this information, and then click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can also enter the first few characters of the name of a group that will control access to applications, click Next, and on the Select Default Provider Group screen, select the group in the list.
segment.target: You can also enter the first few characters of the name of a group that will control access to applications, click Next, and on the Select Default Provider Group screen, select the group in the list.

segment.source: Then save this information and click Next.
segment.target: Then save this information and click Next.

segment.source: On the Installation Wizard Completed page, to close the wizard, click Finish.
segment.target: On the Installation Wizard Completed page, to close the wizard, click Finish.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The installation can take a few minutes to finish.
segment.target: The installation can take a few minutes to finish.

segment.source: A status message will flash above the Windows desktop notification area, indicating whether the installation succeeded.
segment.target: A status message will flash above the Windows desktop notification area, indicating whether the installation succeeded.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: How to Install the Servers and System Components
